dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, what a quarter, right? I mean, GameStop, still hard to believe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, what a quarter, right? I mean, GameStop, still hard to believe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely! Like, the meme stock phenomenon? Just wild. Retail traders really kinda showed the hedge funds, you know, what's what.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely! Like, the meme stock phenomenon? Just wild. Retail traders really kinda showed the hedge funds, you know, what's what.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail investors gave severe nose bleeds to hedge funds which built short positions in GameStop. A lot of this was chiefly due to the fact that retail traders took opposite bets against hedge funds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for real. Those "smart money" institutions, uh, can't really ignore them anymore. We saw it with AMC, AMD, even American Airlines moving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for real. Those smart money institutions, uh, can't really ignore them anymore. We saw it with A M C, A M D, even American Airlines moving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The so called-smart money institutions and money managers can no longer ignore retail traders. Stocks such as AMC, American Airlines, PLTR, AMD and NIO moved significantly higher, but some of them lost their steam.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And speaking of big shifts, I mean, the whole Tesla and Bitcoin story. But then GM goes and invests in Bitcoin? That was huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And speaking of big shifts, I mean, the whole Tesla and Bitcoin story. But then G M goes and invests in Bitcoin? That was huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Another major theme during the first quarter, and possibly the biggest event, was Tesla's investment in Bitcoin.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Like, you gotta wonder if other S&P 500 companies are gonna, uh, follow suit. It's a bold move.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Like, you gotta wonder if other S and P five hundred companies are gonna, uh, follow suit. It's a bold move.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This has opened the conversation that other S&P 500 companies could also diversify their treasury system by allocating some portion of their capital in Bitcoin.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for sure. [overlap] And then on the flip side, SPACs, remember those?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for sure. And then on the flip side, S P A C s, remember those?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, like, they just kindaâ€¦ fell off a cliff, didn't they?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, like, they just kinda... fell off a cliff, didn't they?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! I mean, 50+ this year, celebrities backing them, but the shine wore off. Even Buffett, you know, got in on one with Roger Federer, which was kinda surprising.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! I mean, fifty plus this year, celebrities backing them, but the shine wore off. Even Buffett, you know, got in on one with Roger Federer, which was kinda surprising.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We have had 250+ SPACs so far this year, and celebrities and sports personalities are backing them up as sponsors. Investors like Cathie Wood, from ARK Investment Management LLC, also bought a SPAC with tennis star Serena Williams on the board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. Okay, so from meme stocks and Bitcoin, to SPACs, but then we had that *massive* Archegos blow-up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. Okay, so from meme stocks and Bitcoin, to S P A C s, but then we had that massive Archegos blow-up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was, um, a huge one. Really highlighted the leverage issues, not just for retail, but like, for these massive family offices. Major banks got hit hard.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was, um, a huge one. Really highlighted the leverage issues, not just for retail, but like, for these massive family offices. Major banks got hit hard.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Security Exchange Commission (SEC) isn't only concerned about leverage-related issues concerning retail traders. Archegos Capital Management was given excessive leverage by major banks such as Credit Suisse, Deutsche Bank and many more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Goldman Sachs and JP Morgan, right? I mean, they gave them excessive leverage and then, boom, forced selling of tech stocks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Goldman Sachs and J P Morgan, right? I mean, they gave them excessive leverage and then, boom, forced selling of tech stocks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Archegos Capital Management was given excessive leverage by major banks such as Credit Suisse, Deutsche Bank and many more.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And that kinda brings us to the stimulus. Trump's package, now Biden's, like, three *trillion* dollars.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And that kinda brings us to the stimulus. Trump's package, now Biden's, like, three trillion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. President Joe Biden signed another coronavirus-related stimulus package of $1.9 trillion... President Biden revealed his new infrastructure stimulus plan of $2 trillion yesterday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it's just, uh, injecting so much capital. You gotta wonder how much of that is, like, flowing into the market.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it's just, uh, injecting so much capital. You gotta wonder how much of that is, like, flowing into the market.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We haven't so far seen much evidence that this money is coming into the market, despite several banks producing their estimates of how much of the stimulus check money could be heading towards the stock market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, a lot of estimates say quite a bit. And, you know, honestly, the market seems almost addicted to stimulus news.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, a lot of estimates say quite a bit. And, you know, honestly, the market seems almost addicted to stimulus news.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As for the market, traders are addicted to stimulus-related news, resulting in markets moving much higher.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what does that mean moving forward? More retail power, more volatility?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what does that mean moving forward? More retail power, more volatility?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I think so. The SEC is probably gonna, uh, look at tougher regulations, especially on leverage. Because, I mean, Archegos really showed the systemic risk there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I think so. The S E C is probably gonna, uh, look at tougher regulations, especially on leverage. Because, I mean, Archegos really showed the systemic risk there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The SEC is likely to adopt a tougher stance on family offices to avoid any systematic risk to the financial system. Governance around leverage is going to remain the main focal point.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. So, the battle, uh, continues, huh? With retail still a force.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. So, the battle, uh, continues, huh? With retail still a force.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Battle May Continue... The key point to keep in mind is that we can no longer discount the strength of retail money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Don't discount the strength of retail money, like, ever again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Don't discount the strength of retail money, like, ever again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The key point to keep in mind is that we can no longer discount the strength of retail money.
